page.title: 03HOUSING IN HUNTLY
page.content: There is all kinds of housing in Huntly. There are flats for the old people in Granary street. They were ready for use on the 5 May 1982. They are designed so that the old people will not be lonely. They have a warden there. Some of the old people said Granary Street was called Granary Street because there was once a mill there. Nelson street has houses dating back to 1888 the houses are made of stone. Our block has many of the new council houses. They were built about 10 years ago. These consist of 5 storey blocks of flats semi-detatched and terraced houses all with gardens. Some streets have larger private houses dating back to around to 1900.
